page.title: 10ANITA'S DAY AS MAY QUEEN
page.content: On Club Day 1985 the people in the procession met at the Church at 9am. The procession started and it covered about 3 miles, which I found tiring, although I enjoyed it. Only the 2 non- Catholic Queens were crowned as the Catholic Church has a different custom whereby its Queen crowns a statue of Our Lady on a previous Sunday. After the crowning ceremony the 3 Queens laid a wreath on the village war memorial and the 3 retiring Queens laid wreaths on the crash victims' grave. I had 4 girl attendants who carried my long train of maroon coloured velvet. My cushion bearer was smart in navy and white. My dress was white and had 2 tiers edged with blue. The back fastened with tin bows and it had puffed sleeves gathered into a frill at elbow length, also trimmed with blue.
